results.purpose: Tests Control Center (TCC) for Good Chop marketing campaigns - tracks A/B tests and promotional offers across different marketing channels (SEM, Facebook, CRM, Direct Mail)
key_data_points: 25Q3 campaigns currently active (SEM NB, SEM Comp, SEM Brand, FB)
Common offer structures: $100-$150 discounts with split patterns (50-30-20, 50-30-20-20, etc.)
Popular test variants: Welcome Kit offers, Free Ground Beef, Choose Your Offer, Ribeyes promotions
Geographic targeting: FL (Florida) specific offers, CA (Canada) specific tests
Channel breakdown: SEM (Search Engine Marketing - NB/Comp/Brand), FB (Facebook), CRM, DM (Direct Mail)

entities.name: kelly.abrams@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of SEM campaign tests (NB, Comp, Brand channels)

entities.name: yt@hellofresh.com
entities.context: Owner of CRM and Direct Mail (DM) campaign tests, including Canada-specific tests

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Meat subscription service running promotional tests across multiple marketing channels

entities.name: SEM NB
entities.context: Search Engine Marketing - New Business channel

entities.name: SEM Comp
entities.context: Search Engine Marketing - Competitor targeting channel

entities.name: SEM Brand
entities.context: Search Engine Marketing - Brand keyword channel

insights: Q3 2025 campaigns focus heavily on $100-$120 discount offers with multi-stage discount structures (50-30-20 pattern indicates likely discount percentages across order sequence)
Welcome Kit bundles and Free Ground Beef are primary promotional hooks being tested
Florida (FL) appears to be a key test market with multiple FL-specific offers
SEM campaigns test offer variations (Choose Your Offer vs Welcome Kit vs Free items)
Facebook campaigns test more product-specific offers (Ground Beef vs Ground Sirloin vs Ribeyes)
Campaign naming convention follows pattern: [Quarter] [Channel] [Offer A]__[Offer B] for A/B tests
Recent activity concentrated in July 2025 (last modified dates: 7/10-7/22/2025)
Historical data retained from 2023 campaigns suggests long-term test tracking and learnings
Canada market (CA) has separate test tracks with different offer structures
One unique test: 'BAU Copy__Tariff-Proof Copy' suggests messaging response to economic/trade conditions
